intro: Siphanthera cordifolia var. glomerata, commonly known as the clustered heartleaf siphonthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
